page.title: 01A VILLAGE CALLED CARDROSS
page.content: {LOCATION_}THE VILLAGE OF CARDROSS LIES 4 MILES WEST OF DUMBARTON ON THE A814 AND IS HALFWAY BETWEEN THERE AND HELENSBURGH, FARTHER DOWN THE BANKS OF THE RIVER CLYDE. POSTAL CODE IS G82. {POPULATION_}OF CARDROSS IS ABOUT 2,500 OF WHICH ABOUT 350 LIVE IN THE BLOCK BEING STUDIED FOR THIS 1985 DOMESDAY PROJECT.{ {GEOGRAPHY_}THE VILLAGE HAS A SOUTH FACING OUTLOOK AND GOES FROM SEA LEVEL IN THE S.W. TO A HEIGHT OF SOME 220 FT. ABOVE SEA LEVEL IN THE N.E. SECTION. {SERVICES_}IN RECENT YEARS, IT HAS BECOME SOMETHING OF A COMMUTERS' VILLAGE WITH AN ELECTRIC TRAIN SERVICE BETWEEN GLASGOW AND HELENSBURGH. NUCLEAR BASES AT FASLANE AND COULPORT ALSO PROVIDE JOBS FOR THE LOCAL PEOPLE.
